my:Details.my:Title: Works Carried Out in Heavy Weather Conditions

my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) No seafarers should be on deck during heavy weather unless it is absolutely necessary for the safety of the crew or safety of the ship and this approval should be given only by Master. Attention should be given to the dangers of allowing any person out on deck during heavy weather. b) Lifelines should be rigged in appropriate locations on deck if heavy weather is expected. c) The lashing of all deck cargo should be inspected and tightened as necessary when heavy weather is expected. Only if it is necessary to be performed, the work on deck during heavy weather should be authorized by the Master and the bridge watch should be informed. d) Should it be deemed necessary to send crew members on deck by the Master, the ship should be brought around to reduce the ship's movement.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Works on deck and engine room areas
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a)Any person required to go on deck during heavy weather should wear a life jacket and be equipped with a portable transceiver. If possible, the person should remain in communication with a backup person and be visible at all times. b)Works in Engine Room should be carefully planed when heavy weather is expected. Additional care should be considered and everything should be secured in working places/ workshop etc. CoSWP manual should be consulted.
At all times, all seafarers should wear PPE : overalls, hard hats, safety shoes, gloves and if they are proceeding on - deck life jackets.

Use of suitable and appropriate PPE: overalls, safety shoes, hard hat, gloves, lifejackets, etc. Adequate lighting to be provided, use of portable lighting if necessary should be taken in consideration. Trip hazards and any overhead obstructions to be clearly marked. All steps, platforms and deck surface should be clear of any oil and/ or grease residue.
